newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's Le Pen fined one franc for defamation.
newsitem.headline: France's Le Pen fined one franc for defamation.

text.p: A French court on Wednesday ordered far-right leader Jean-Marie Le Pen to pay a symbolic one franc in damages to the organisers of a rally against his National Front party.
Le Pen's lawyer Georges-Paul Wagner said he would probably appeal against the conviction for slandering the association Ras l'Front (Fed up with the Front).

The court in the eastern city of Strasbourg ruled that Le Pen, who won 15 percent of the vote in 1995 presidential elections, defamed the Ras l'Front organisers of a rally against him in Strasbourg in 1995 by calling them "cop killers".

Wagner had argued in court that Le Pen's televised remarks in fact referred to a radical anti-fascist group whose sympathisers are thought to include two youths who shot dead five people, including three policemen, in Paris in 1994.
